Blog About

About

For some reason you want to know about me

If you want to know what I am up to right now, please head over to @marcgg on Twitter. I also write things in my blog. The most recent article is 2 Days Trying To Create a Multiplayer HTML5 Game, you should take a look!

Professionally

To sum it up, I'm a software engineer focused on web development with some team leading experience. I enjoy building new and inovating things while helping my teammates moving forward.

Since January 2013 I am the Lead Back-end developer at Drivy (FR), a startup creating a peer to peer car rental service following the principles of collaborative consumption.

Before that I spent 3 years as the Lead Developer of Tigerlily (FR), a parisian startup helping large brands to improve their presence on Facebook and Twitter. I also worked for Analog Method (NYC), an agency focusing delivering very high quality software and Live Technology (NY) , a startup developing a large scale web application to optimize marketing. Lastly, I spent two internships developing intranet web apps at Sagem and Altran.

Even before, I studied at the University of Paris XI & Florida International University where I got a Masters Degree in Computer Science.

Projects

At Tigerlily I'm working on projects like the Conversation Suite or our insights solution that are used by major brands (Orange, Universal, Spotify, Sony, LVMH, Disney, M&M's...).

When I'm home, I spend time on an quantified self iOS app using RubyMotion. I also play around with random projects, such as a Twitter bot acting like a social media consultant, a website mapping airport codes to user names or an iOS app. One of my most polished project is ffocused, a free service giving users the ability to create their fully customizable photo portfolio based on their Facebook, Flickr or Instagram accounts

I love how open source changed the way we see software, and, time permitting, I try to contribute as I can. Right now I've released the source of a few small projects on my GitHub (including ffocused), RubyMotion examples and any simple plugins that I create to make my life easier. I also have a couple of commits in projects such as Ruby on Rails, Koala, the best Facebook gem out there. Finally when I have time I hang out on Stackoverflow where I earn quite a lot of internet points.

Travel & Photography

I tend to travel, couch surf and take pictures. You can see the best ones on my photo portfolio or check out my Instagram.

Some of my pictures won contests or got published (including one in New York's Village Voice). Others are available for purchase, so feel free to buy one here!

Contact

If you want to meet up in Paris and have a chat, don't hesitate to drop me a line. I'm very rarely available for freelance work, but if you have a good project I'd be happy to discuss it with you and give away some pointers if I can.

You can reach me via @marcgg on Twitter, my LinkedIn account or my email "marcg.gauthier-at-gmail-dot-com".
